page.title: 13All Saints Church Kirby Hill
page.content: The church is possibly the most obvious feature in the village. The nave is part Saxon and part Norman built with large irregular stones. The site of the church is significant. it is on the highest point of the village, and in line with Aldborough and the probable site of the Roman crossing of the River Ure. it may be that the present church is on the site of a much earlier sacred shrine dating back to the time of the Roman or even Celtic times. The Parish of Kirby hill is now part of a wider group of parishes which include Skelton, Norton Le Clay and Cundall. The present incumbent still lives in the Vicarage in Kirby Hill.
